definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither

zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither

sentences.english: There were woods and few houses along the way.
sentences.chinese: 路旁是一片树林，还有零零星星的几所房子。

sentences.english: Enters the shop fragmentarily the customer basic hires the housing primarily.
sentences.chinese: 零零星星进店的顾客基本以出租住房为主。

sentences.english: I only learned about the incident in dribs and drabs.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个事件，我只是零零星星地听说了一些。

sentences.english: A few foreigners get hired here and there but it's not very common at all.
sentences.chinese: 他们零零星星地雇佣一些外国人，但并不算很普遍。

sentences.english: Sporadic blocks of houses in the village, there are mountains of tea.
sentences.chinese: 村内零零星星几幢房屋，还有满山的油茶。

definition: numerous and close together/densely packed/thickly dotted/thick/dense
lit. to fill the whole sky and cover the land; everywhere/as far as the eye can see
in groups of three or four (idiom)
